examples: with time, the words are effaced by the frost and the rain
his anger was effaced when he stepped into the open air

verb.description: Make oneself appear insignificant or inconspicuous.
synonyms: keep out of the public eye

origin: Late 15th century (in the sense pardon or be absolved from (an offense)): from French effacer, from e- (from Latin ex- away from) + face face.
